data.name: Auto.Text
data.value: Auto - The "Auto" installation method bypasses the Wizard completely and uses the legacy Auto-Install procedure.

data.name: ChooseDbError.Text
data.value: You must choose a Database Type

data.name: ConfirmPassword.Text
data.value: The confirm password entered is not the same as the password entered.

data.name: DatabaseFileHelp.Text
data.value: Enter the name of the Database File (located in the App_Data Directory)

data.name: Full.Text
data.value: Custom - The "Custom" installation method provides you with the ability to completely customise your DotNetNuke installation. Select this option if you wish to control which optional components get installed.

data.name: Install.Error
data.value: There was a problem with the Installation of the Database.

data.name: Installed.Text
data.value: DotNetNuke is already Installed on this system.

data.name: IntegratedHelp.Text
data.value: Check this if you are using SQL Server's Integrated Security, which means you will be using your Windows account to access SQL Server. If you are using SQL Server Express then you will most likely need to check this option. If you have been given a UserId/Password to access your Database, leave this unchecked, and provide the UserId/Password combination.

data.name: MinUserNamelength.Text
data.value: The minimum length for the user name is 4 characters

data.name: NoLanguages.Text
data.value: There are no languages to install.

data.name: NoModules.Text
data.value: There are no modules to install

data.name: NoPackages.Text
data.value: There are no authentication systems to install.

data.name: NoPassword.Text
data.value: You must provide a password for the user

data.name: OwnerHelp.Text
data.value: Check this if you are running the database as Database Owner - if left unchecked you will be running as the User ID specified

data.name: IntroDetail.Text
data.value:
Welcome to the DotNetNuke Installation Wizard. This wizard will guide you through the installation of your DotNetNuke Application.

You may navigate through the Wizard using the Next and Previous buttons. On some pages you will see a third button "Test ...". This button will allow you to test the configuration before you continue, to see the effects of changes.

The first step is to select the installation method to use and to choose the language you would like to use for the Installation.

data.name: PermissionsDetail.Text
data.value:
DotNetNuke has extensive file upload capabilities for content, modules, and skins. These features require custom security settings so that the application is able to create and remove files in your website.

This page checks the current file permissions to ensure that these features will work correctly.

Note:The test checks the root folder of your application. In most cases this is good enough, as child folders usually inherit their file and folder permissions from their parent. However, occasionally this test will pass, but there will be a more restrictive permission set on one of the descendant files/folders.

data.name: DatabaseConfigDetail.Text
data.value:
You can configure the database settings used by DotNetNuke on this page. If you are installing DotNetNuke in a "Hosting Account" your hosting provider should have provided you with the information.

There are two options for SQL Server 2005/2008. SQLServer 2005 and SQL Server 2008 support the use of Database Files. In most situations you should choose the Database option, but if you are using SQL Server 2005/2008 Express then you should use the File option.

data.name: DatabaseInstallDetail.Text
data.value: The installation of the database scripts should have started when this page loaded. The Next button will be disabled until the Installation of the Scripts is complete.

data.name: HostUserDetail.Text
data.value: In this page you should provide the information for the Host or SuperUser User Account. This user has access to all portals created on the site, and care should be taken to provide a UserName/Password combination that is difficult to "hack" by malicious users.

data.name: ModulesDetail.Text
data.value:
DotNetNuke has a powerful extensibility. This extensibility is provided through the concept of "installable" modules.

On this page you can choose the optional Modules to install. Installing the Modules makes them available to Portal Administrators.

data.name: PortalDetail.Text
data.value:
In this page you will configure the Host (or initial) Portal (website).

You will need to provide an administrator user account. This user has access to all functionality of the portal, and as with the Host User care should be taken to provide a UserName/Password combination that is difficult to "hack" by malicious users.

data.name: SkinsDetail.Text
data.value:
DotNetNuke has a rich skinning capability. On this page you can choose the Skins and Containers to install.

Installing a Skin and/or container does not automatically enable it, but it makes the skin available to you.

data.name: LanguagesDetail.Text
data.value: DotNetNuke is fully localizable. On this page you can choose the languages you wish to install.

data.name: PasswordHelp.Text
data.value: Enter the Password for the Database

data.name: PasswordLength.Text
data.value: The password must be at least {0} characters.

data.name: PasswordUser.Text
data.value: You cannot set the Password to the same value as the User Name.

data.name: PermissionsError.Text
data.value:
Your site failed the permissions check.

Using Windows Explorer, browse to the root folder of the website ( {0} ). Right-click the folder and select Sharing and Security from the popup menu. Select the Security tab. Add the appropriate User Account and set the Permissions.

If using Windows 2000 - IIS5

The {Server}\ASPNET User Account must have Read, Write, and Change Control of the virtual root of your website.

If using Windows 2003, Windows Vista or Windows Server 2008 and IIS6 or IIS7

The NT AUTHORITY\NETWORK SERVICE User Account must have Read, Write, and Change Control of the virtual root of your Website.

If using Windows 7 or Windows Server 2008 R2 and IIS7.5

The IIS AppPool\DefaultAppPool User Account must have Read, Write, and Change Control of the virtual root of your Website.

data.name: PermissionsOk.Text
data.value: Your site passed the permissions check.

data.name: QualifierHelp.Text
data.value: Enter an optional "prefix" to use for all your database objects - this helps ensure that there are no object name clashes.

data.name: ServerHelp.Text
data.value: Enter the Name or IP Address of the computer where the Database is located. (if using Oracle enter the Data Source (SID))

data.name: Typical.Text
data.value: Typical - The "Typical" installation method makes some "typical" choices for you.

data.name: Upgrade.Text
data.value: DotNetNuke version {0} is already Installed. Click the Next button to upgrade to the new version.

data.name: UserHelp.Text
data.value: Enter the UserID for the Database

data.name: AuthSystemsDetail.Text
data.value:
DotNetNuke supports multiple authentication systems. On this page you can choose the systems you wish to install.

Installing an Authentication System does not automatically enable it for each portal, but it makes the system available to a Portal Adminstrator.

data.name: ProvidersDetail.Text
data.value: DotNetNuke uses a provider model for extensions. On this page you can choose the Providers to install.

data.name: EmailErrorMessage.Text
data.value:
There has been an error trying to send the test email. The error is:
{0}

data.name: SMTPSettingsHelp.Text
data.value: You can configure and test your SMTP Server settings.

data.name: SpecifyHostEmailMessage.Text
data.value: You Must Specify The Host Email Address

data.name: EnableUpdate.Text
data.value: Do you want the software to display a visual indicator to notify you when updates are available?

data.name: UpdateDetail.Text
data.value: This software can routinely check for the latest important updates for your website. These updates can include security updates, critical updates and patches. (No information is collected that can be used to identify you or contact you without your explicit consent.)

data.name: UpdateEmail.Text
data.value: Do you want to receive notifications by email regarding updates to the software?

data.name: UpdateTitle.Text
data.value: Update Service - Help protect the Integrity of your Website

data.name: HostWarning.Text
data.value: Your Host Name contains illegal characters (only A-Z, 0-9, - and . are allowed). You should modify the host name used.

data.name: DatabaseWarning.Text
data.value: The Auto option has been disabled as the DotNetNuke Application cannot connect to a valid SQL Server database. You can continue to use either of the other two Wizard options and configure the Database settings at the appropriate Wizard step.

data.name: DbNameError.Text
data.value: You must enter the name of the database.
